title: Murder suspect in triple shooting in Muskegon arrested in Arizona
content:
MUSKEGON, MI - A man wanted for killing one person and injuring two others has been taken into custody.
Royderrick Collier was arrested in the Phoenix, Ariz. area on Aug. 16 on warrant charges for open murder, two counts of assault with intent to murder and two counts of felony firearm.
The warrants were issued in a shooting that happened at 8 p.m. on Saturday, June 18, in the 900 block of Muskegon's East Isabella Avenue.
An argument seemed to provoke a shooting, police said. Responders found three gunshot victims lying in a yard. Naethon Darnel Sims, 17, died at the hospital, while the other two recovered.
Muskegon Police Department Detectives worked with the U.S. Marshals Fugitive Task Force in Grand Rapids throughout the investigation. Information was forwarded to U.S. Marshals in Phoenix. An investigator from the Phoenix Task Force arrested Collier at a residence in Glendale, Ariz.
Collier is being held in the Maricopa County Jail and is expected to appear in court in Maricopa County. Once his extradition proceedings are complete, he will be transported back to Muskegon.
Naethon Sims, 17, was shot dead and two others were wounded.
